intro: Hampea appendiculata var. longicalyx, commonly known as the long-fruited hampea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its elongated, cylindrical fruits that hang from the plant, often containing several seeds. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, thriving in well-drained soils and full sun. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a velvety texture. The flowers are usually small and clustered, with five petals that are pale yellow to white in color.
